WorkItem.Description:
Calling HasErrors on expression 1 + 1. throws EarlyExitException. This error somehow is not catched by the 
try catch code in HasErrors function.

Comments.Message:
Actually I noticed that it is not an error, only the debugger in Visual Studio is throwing this error. The release version is working. So this is not a bug.
Found this here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36014/why-is-net-exception-not-caught-by-try-catch-block
